string.text: If Haruka's Skill System mod is installed and this option is enabled, FFTD will take the movement speed multiplier from your Endurance skill into account and adjust travel times accordingly, e.g. a movement multiplier of 1.15 would reduce all fast travel times by approximately 15%.\n\nIf Skill System is not installed, this setting has no effect.

If enabled for this travel type, a random delay may be added to each trip according to the settings below. A setting of 0-2 hours and 0-59 minutes will precisely replicate Anomaly's vanilla behavior, if desired.
If enabled, most survival stats (hunger, thirst) will be frozen for the duration of this travel type.
Hire fast travel guides from the PDA map
You must wait this many realtime seconds between fast travel trips. To disable this feature, set it to zero.
You must wait this many realtime seconds between backpack travel trips. To disable this feature, set it to zero.
You must wait this many realtime seconds between guided travel trips. To disable this feature, set it to zero.
Guides take time to reach you
If enabled, the trip duration will include calculations of how long it takes the guide to travel from their origin point to where the player is.
If enabled, guides will only be available if there is one who is based out of the current map.
Guides are loyal to their faction
If enabled, guides will refuse to do business with players who are enemies of their faction. Guides will, however, look the other way if the player is properly disguised.
All travel types share cooldown trigger

If this option is enabled, the cooldowns for all travel types are linked--that is, when one is triggered, they all are. For example, travelling to a backpack will also trigger the cooldowns, if any, for fast travel and guided travel.\n\nWhen disabled, each travel type tracks its cooldown separately, if applicable.

When launched in Debug mode, vanilla Anomaly allows fast travel to stalkers, area markers, and various other debug mapspots that aren't normally valid destinations. This can be undesirable, because these markers can get in the way and cause you to teleport to the wrong place, like behind Barkeep or another trader. By default, FFT filters these out.\n\nEnabling this setting will revert to the vanilla behavior. Unless you are testing something, or stuck in the map and need to get out, it is recommended that you leave this option disabled at all times.

This is the default form of fast travel, which is controlled by all of Anomaly's fast travel settings. If a travel option says "fast travel" rather than "backpack" or "guide", it is using the settings on this page.

Backpack travel allows you to fast travel to placed backpack stashes, and is also managed by Anomaly's backpack travel settings. It will show the proper names for stashes that were created after FFT's installation.

Guide travel is unique to FFT, and allows you to hire a veteran guide to escort you to your destination. You must pay them, but guides are assumed to pack supplies for the journey--your survival stats will be paused during the trip (configurable below), and they will come get you even if you are hurt or overweight, ignoring those two settings. However, there are certain places they simply will not go for pay.
Allow travel to Quick Pin markers? (requires PAW)

If enabled for this type of travel, Quick Pin markers can be used as fast travel destinations. Pin Travel requires the Personal Adjustable Waypoint addon, and this setting has no effect if it is not installed.\n\nThis is only allowed for Quick Pins because they can only be placed in locations that are reachable by the player.
The Pin Travel feature requires the Personal Adjustable Waypoint addon:\nhttps://www.moddb.com/mods/stalker-anomaly/addons/personal-adjustable-waypoint-for-anomaly-151-152-and-gamma

A bug in vanilla Anomaly causes disguises to be blown if you fast travel near NPCs with time passage enabled. This setting fixes the bug by disabling time-based suspicion in the disguise settings until the timeskip is complete. This should never be disabled except for troubleshooting.

In vanilla Anomaly, the distance calculation only works correctly within the same map. When calculating travel to other maps, it often produces bizarre and nonsensical results. FFT replaces this method with a global distance calculation.\n\nThe vanilla method is bad and you should never enable this--but for compatibility reasons you can if you really, really need to.

By default, only Guide Travel has a cost. You can optionally set the other two travel types to have a cost as well, and if this value is greater than zero, they will use the same calculations as Guide Travel.

If enabled, Guide Travel ignores the settings that prevent fast travel if the player is bleeding, irradiated, or overweight. This is to represent that guides are willing to administer first aid or help you carry some of your burden.
The maximum distance at which the player is considered to be "in combat" for the purposes of blocking fast travel.
If an enemy has not seen the player for this many seconds, they no longer count for the purposes of blocking fast travel.
Use Warfare Alife Overhaul addon fix

If this is enabled and Warfare Mode is active, FFT will skip trying to add fast travel icons to the map. If map icons or context menus aren't working correctly when the Warfare Alife Overhaul addon is installed, try enabling this.
Allow opening backpacks from the map
Enabling this option will re-enable a vanilla feature that allows you to open a backpack from anywhere on the same map. For balance reasons, this is off by default.

Adjusts the multiplier for the amount of condition damage applied to all of the player's equipped gear when fast traveling. The further you go, the more wear and tear.

Values around 1 or 2 are recommended as a "normal" difficulty setting, while the maximum setting of 11 is probably far beyond overkill for most normal play.

Setting this to zero will disable the feature for this travel type.

All Gear: condition loss is applied to all equipped gear
 Random: condition loss is applied to one equipped item at random
 Armor: condition loss is applied to equipped armor and helmet
 Weapons: condition loss is applied to equipped weapons
 Disabled: turns off all equipment condition loss for all travel types, regardless of their individual settings.

If the player would normally be prevented from traveling due to radiation or bleeding, they will also be unable to travel if their health is below this percentage. Setting this to zero effectively disables the feature.

If the player would normally be prevented from traveling due to radiation or bleeding, they will also be unable to travel if their "satiety" (hunger/thirst) is below this percentage. Setting this to zero effectively disables the feature.
Allow usage of regular fast travel
Some settings also apply to NPC guides
You paid a guide %s to bring you to your destination.
Prices scale based on player rank
If enabled, all fast travel costs will increase along a curve based on the player's rank. The rise in cost is slow at first, and maxes out at the multiplier below.

When the player reaches the maximum rank defined below, all fast travel costs will be increased by this multiplier. Below that rank, the multiplier will scale along an escalating curve from zero to this setting. [Curve func: 1 - cos((x * pi) / 2)]
If the progressive cost setting is enabled, this is the rank value at which costs stop increasing.
Cost to hire NPCs in dialogue
When hiring an NPC guide face-to-face from dialogue, this cost per meter is used instead of the usual value.
If enabled, the vanilla prices will be used instead of FFT's calculations when hiring NPC guides in person.
If enabled, fares that FFT generates will be rounded down to the nearest 100 in order to resemble the cleaner appearance of the vanilla prices.
A powerful psy field prevents travel to this location

If enabled, the Brain Scorcher's psy field will block all fast travel between the north and south of the map until it is deactivated, including guide travel. This setting has no effect unless story mode is enabled.
Show distance and duration in context menu

If enabled, all fast travel options will show the distance and duration in the PDA map's context menu. Disabling this option will remove this useful information, making the menus appear more like vanilla.
"Verbose" is programmer-speak for "really spammy". This puts the maximum amount of information into the log, and must be enabled if you are reporting a problem.
You can only initiate %s from bases owned by a friendly faction
You can only initiate %s from within your own faction's bases
Only allow travel from faction bases

Optionally restrict from where the player may initiate travel:
 Disabled: travel may be initiated from anywhere, just as in vanilla.
 Friendly: travel may only be initiated if the player is within the boundaries of a friendly faction base. Recommended for most players.
 Own Faction: travel may only be initiated if the player is within the boundaries of their own faction's bases. This will impact some factions more than others.
Can use enemy faction bases while disguised

If a "only travel from faction bases" option is enabled, enabling this option as well will allow players in an appropriate disguise to also fast travel from the bases of unfriendly factions. Without this option, wearing a disguise will have no effect on fast travel permission.
Show status icon when in a travel zone

When enabled, a unique icon will appear in the usual status indicator area when the player is within a fast travel zone that is valid for them. This setting is meaningless if you are not restricting the initiation of travel to faction bases or campfires.\n You can choose from one of three styles--one vanilla, and two which are meant to match the style of the Alternative Icons set (b/w and color).
If enabled, being within 5 meters of a lit campfire counts as being within a faction base for the purposes of fast travel.

If enabled, allows campfires to be used as fast travel destinations:
 Any: any known campfire is a valid fast travel destination.
 Lit: a campfire must be lit in order to be used as a fast travel destination.
 Campfires aren't shown on the map in vanilla, so using them as fast travel destinations requires an addon such as Haruka's Display Campfires on Map (included in GAMMA):
 https://www.moddb.com/mods/stalker-anomaly/addons/displaycampfiresonmap

Vanilla Anomaly leaves player squadmates behind when traveling within the same map. If this option is enabled, Fair Fast Travel will attempt to teleport all companions so that they travel with the player. Note that due to engine limitations with teleporting NPCs, this doesn't always work reliably. This is not an issue with the addon.

Fair Fast Travel will try to bring your companions to your current location. It does this automatically whenever you fast travel locally if that option is enabled, but you can manually force them to teleport to you. Unrescued hostages and companions told to wait will not be teleported.
If fast travel is blocked to a specific destination due to the Brain Scorcher still being active (or for any other reason), the icon used by the fast travel point will change to reflect that.

 %c[ui_gray_2] 
%c[pda_yellow]Fair Fast Travel%c[ui_gray_2] is a comprehensive overhaul for Anomaly's fast travel and backpack travel systems. It places you in total control over how travel behaves in your game, letting you make it as restrictive or as lenient as you like.


Every feature can be customized to your liking in the MCM menus. Don't want any travel type to have a cost? Set cost per meter to zero. Want to make it so that you can only fast travel to and from lit campfires? You can. %c[pda_white]If you don't like how something works, check MCM first!


%c[pda_white]From %c[pda_yellow]MCM > Fair Fast Travel%c[pda_white]:
 %c[pda_yellow]General%c[pda_white]: Settings affecting the UI, or that apply to all travel types
 %c[pda_yellow]Fast Travel%c[pda_white]: Travel type settings, only for options using the exact words "fast travel"
 %c[pda_yellow]Backpack Travel%c[pda_white]: Travel type settings, apply only when traveling to a backpack stash
 %c[pda_yellow]Guide Travel%c[pda_white]: Travel type settings, apply only to travel initiated with NPC guides, whether from the PDA or (with the Guide Travel Overhaul option installed) in person.
 

%c[pda_red]Still having difficulties? Scroll down for troubleshooting information.
 %c[ui_gray_2] 
%c[pda_green]FEATURE LIST
 %c[pda_yellow]В• Better Trip Durations%c[ui_gray_2] 
By default, travel within the same map consistently takes 10 minutes per 100m of distance (configurable in MCM), and--unlike vanilla Anomaly--has no random element. This is roughly equal to the time it would take to travel the same distance at the character's normal in-game walking speed--it assumes that you are neither sprinting nor being unduly delayed. Travel to other maps uses the same formula, but can be customized separately.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Better Context Menu UI%c[ui_gray_2] 
When right-clicking on a map icon, the fast travel option will now also tell you how far away it is, and approximately how long it will take to get there and (if applicable) how much it will cost.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Guided Travel from PDA Map%c[ui_gray_2] 
The Zone is full of veteran guides of all factions who are willing to carry your loot or come to your aid--for a price. Now you can hire them by right-clicking on the map to go to any valid fast travel point. Hired guides are assumed to bring provisions for the journey, and your survival stats are paused during the trip. What's more, guided travel will ignore the "wounded" and "overweight" rules, if either are enabled in Anomaly's base game settings.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• NPC Guide Travel Overhaul%c[ui_gray_2] 
If you installed this option, NPC guides have been completely overhauled to bring them in line with the rest of the fast travel system--with details such as duration and cost fully managed by Fair Fast Travel. Travelling with a hired NPC guide now takes time just like any other fast travel trip, and obey all of Guide Travel's settings--including pausing your survival stats.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Optional Equipment Condition Loss%c[ui_gray_2] 
Whether it's from taking a stray bullet or the fact that you had to fire one, most journeys in the Zone leave their mark on your equipment in the form of normal wear and tear. If you wish, FFT lets you simulate this by applying a configurable amount of condition loss to your equipped items, with separate values for every travel type. Setting it to zero will disable the feature, and like everything else it is configurable in MCM.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Configurable Cooldowns%c[ui_gray_2] 
Each of the three fast travel types can now be configured with a cooldown of up to two hours before that travel type can be used again. The remaining duration will always be shown in the context menu option. Each travel type can have its own separate cooldown, or you can link them all so that when one cooldown is triggered, they all are. Of course, all cooldowns are optional--and off by default.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Restrict Travel to Friendly Bases Only%c[ui_gray_2] 
This optional feature can separately restrict each travel type so that the player can only initiate travel when they are within a friendly base. This preserves the QoL of fast travel while preventing the player from cheaply teleporting out of anomaly fields or other dangers. Everything is configurable, including whether an appropriate faction disguise will "fool" this feature.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Campfire Travel Options, Travel Indicator%c[ui_gray_2] 
Campfires can optionally be used as fast travel destinations. By default, this is enabled only for Guide Travel, in order to represent the value added by a guide's knowledge of local routes. If you're using the option that restricts fast travel to bases only, you can now optionally choose to have lit campfires count as friendly bases for travel purposes as well. If installed, the feature also has an optional status indicator that will show when you're currently in a valid travel zone.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Gate Northern Travel Behind Story Progress%c[ui_gray_2] 
If you're playing as most factions in Story Mode, and the Brain Scorcher hasn't been disabled yet, certain guide and fast travel routes will be unavailable until you shut off the Monolith's science toys. Of course, like anything else, you can turn this off in MCM.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Filter Out Debug Mapspots%c[ui_gray_2] 
Many of us play Anomaly in Debug Mode for troubleshooting purposes, but playing in that mode enables unrestricted fast travel to any visible map icon--even to things like level transitions or traders that aren't supposed to be destinations, often resulting in accidents like teleporting behind the Barkeep or to the wrong icon. By default, FFT filters out all of these invalid mapspots while Debug Mode is on--but if you do actually want them, there's an option in MCM to re-enable them.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Better Combat Detection%c[ui_gray_2] 
When deciding whether you're in combat for travel purposes, FFT uses Anomaly's list of NPCs in combat, but filters out any that are more than 100 meters away, or which haven't seen you in the last ten seconds.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Skill System Integration%c[ui_gray_2] 
If you have Haruka's %c[pda_white]Skill System%c[ui_gray_2] or one of the expansion addons built upon it, you can optionally choose to have Fair Fast Travel adjust all travel times based on the modifier from your Endurance skill.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Personal Adjustable Waypoint Pin Travel%c[ui_gray_2] 
If you have my %c[pda_white]Personal Adjustable Waypoint%c[ui_gray_2] addon, you can now optionally allow fast travel to Quick Pin markers that you've placed in the world, letting you set up custom fast travel points virtually anywhere that you can reach!
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Western Goods Support%c[ui_gray_2] 
The latest version of the %c[pda_white]Western Goods%c[ui_gray_2] addon includes a dynamic guide feature which adds several new guides and allows others to be easily added. Fair Fast Travel is compatible with this feature straight out of the box, with no settings or installation options necessary. Western Goods guides will calculate and show distance and travel time just like any other.
 

%c[pda_yellow]В• Disguise Bugfix%c[ui_gray_2] 
FFT fixes a vanilla Anomaly bug that causes your disguise to be exposed if you fast travel in front of an NPC with the "consider time spent near NPCs" option enabled.

%c[pda_red]Q: %c[pda_white]Why does it say something about a "powerful psy field" when I try to right-click on some destinations?
 %c[pda_green]A: %c[pda_white]You are playing in story mode, and the Brain Scorcher is still active. You can disable this option in MCM: %c[pda_yellow]Fair Fast Travel > General > Brain Scorcher blocks travel
 

%c[pda_red]Q: %c[pda_white]Why can't I fast travel to a pin I placed using Personal Adjustable Waypoint?
 %c[pda_green]A: %c[pda_white]Only Quick Pins can be used as destinations, because they can only be placed in spots where the player can reach. If this is a Quick Pin, then Pin Travel is not enabled in MCM for this travel type.
 

%c[pda_red]В•В•В• IMPORTANT: To report any bug, you must do the following: В•В•В•
 
 %c[pda_white]1. Go to %c[pda_yellow]MCM > Fair Fast Travel > General
 %c[pda_white]2. Enable %c[pda_yellow]Debug logging%c[pda_white] and %c[pda_yellow]Verbose logging
 %c[pda_white]3. Exit and restart the game
 %c[pda_white]4. Reproduce the issue as simply as possible
 %c[pda_white]5. Get the game log from %c[pda_yellow](Your Anomaly Folder)\appdata\logs%c[pda_white] and post it somewhere online
 

%c[ui_gray_2]If you do not, it is unlikely your log will have the information I need.


I don't get notified about Moddb comments, so you will generally get the quickest response on the GAMMA Discord, in Fair Fast Travel's discussion channel. Unsolicited DMs will be ignored.
Fast Travel Blocked by Psy Field

%c[ui_gray_2]If you're playing in %c[pda_yellow]Story Mode%c[ui_gray_2], and you haven't yet deactivated the %c[pda_yellow]Brain Scorcher%c[ui_gray_2], the %c[pda_yellow]Fair Fast Travel%c[ui_gray_2] addon includes an optional feature which prevents any fast travel trip that might require passing through the affected area of influence. Destinations which are unavailable for this reason will be indicated by the special icon you see above.


%c[pda_white]To restore fast travel to these locations, either progress the main story or disable the feature in the Mod Configuration Menu:
 
 %c[pda_yellow]MCM > Fair Fast Travel > General > Brain Scorcher blocks travel
Scale travel costs by map threat

When this option is enabled, Fair Fast Travel will scale travel costs based on the highest "threat" level of the origin and destination maps. Put simply, it means that travelling within "newbie" areas like Cordon and Swamps will cost less, while travel to and from "endgame" maps like Pripyat will be more expensive.
